definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the old woman was also radiant with joy, returned to her home.
sentences.chinese: 同时，这位老婆婆也容光焕发地回到了家里。

sentences.english: There is a glow of health in his face.

sentences.chinese: 照她一个密友的话说，简直是“容光焕发”。
皮肤看起来水润容光焕发。

sentences.english: He was glowing and warm with delight.
sentences.chinese: 他乐得容光焕发，心里暖烘烘的。

sentences.english: Her face was bright with pleasure, her dress perfect. Everyone looked at her.
sentences.chinese: 她脸上容光焕发，衣着完美无暇，人人都朝她看。
新娘满脸微笑，容光焕发。

sentences.english: THE numbers keep rising, the superlatives keep glowing.
sentences.chinese: 这些数字不断上升，最高级保持容光焕发。

sentences.english: Smile seemed heartless in its brilliancy .
sentences.chinese: 她那容光焕发的微笑似乎是残酷的。

sentences.english: Her face was transfigured with joy.
sentences.chinese: 她的面容因高兴而容光焕发。

sentences.english: Eating Jujubes frequently can make us look healthy.
sentences.chinese: 常吃红枣可使人面色红润，容光焕发。

definition: in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
in glowing spirits (idiom); bursting with life/radiating health and vigor
in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
in great spirits/to have great vitality
spirit trembling with excitement (idiom); in high spirits/lively and full of enthusiasm/full of energy/con brio
lit. vitality a hundredfold (idiom); refreshed/one's vigor thoroughly restored
wan and sallow/thin and pallid/haggard/(of plants) withered
